file_content.text: You're my CO now, so I'll follow your lead--but only because it means a shot at Tavus.
I can't believe this! Your backstabbing squad-mates have cost me everything!
You did it, Sergeant! That was some top-notch soldiering--we're all proud of you.
Just doing my job.
I encountered Imperial soldiers guarding the bomb!
There are Imperials here!
Copy that, we saw them through your armor-cam. Unbelievable.
It isn't easy being the best.
Don't get too cocky yet, Sergeant.
Looks like we've got a whole new problem. Not all of those guards you killed were seps.
Imperial soldiers operating right alongside the separatists. We need to know how deep this connection goes. I want you to continue further into the base.
What is my immediate objective?
Copy that.
Shouldn't I locate Tavus and the others first, sir?
What about my squad?
I agree, Sergeant.
I'll clean this place out.
Make sure you drop a few of them for me, Sergeant.
Finding the rest of Havoc Squad is now priority one. If they've been captured, they might be able to tell us more about what's going on in there.
If possible, you should also retrieve the ZR-57. It costs about forty million credits, so Command would like it back. But your squad-mates are the main objective now.
If my squad-mates are here, I will bring them home.
Understood, sir.
Good luck, Sergeant.
There's no point looking for a bunch of corpses, sir.
They're probably dead.
We don't leave people behind, Sergeant. Now get moving.
If you learn anymore, be sure to contact me.
Keep me posted, sir.
You got it, Sergeant.
There's no time to waste, Sergeant! Get into that stronghold and disarm that bomb once and for all!
Commander Tavus was very clear: Under no circumstances can I send you in to join Havoc on this mission.
I have to admit, I'm a little surprised. I honestly thought you were starting to come along, but I guess Tavus still isn't convinced you're ready for the big time.
I trust Commander Tavus's judgment.
It's the commander's call.
If Tavus wants me to relax here while everyone else charges into enemy territory, it's fine by me.
As long as I'm paid the same.
That's the spirit. I'm sure--
I found that bomb--I should be the one to retrieve it.
But my record is flawless!
Maybe next time, Sergeant. I'm sure--
Lieutenant, sir! We've got a situation here!
Talk to me, Ensign. What's going on?
We've lost contact with Havoc Squad, sir! Comms, video, locators, everything. It's like they've disappeared completely.
What do you mean disappeared? Are the seps jamming us?
No jamming we can detect. I don't know what's happening. They're just gone, sir.
That's unacceptable, soldier! You get back to that terminal, and you get me Havoc's status, now!
Yes, sir!
Send me in, Lieutenant--they may need assistance.
I should investigate.
It'd be breaking Tavus's orders, but if it comes to that--
Do you think Zak and Jaller set us up, sir?
Was this an ambush?
There's no way to tell from here. Whatever happened was bad.
Sounds like Commander Tavus got my squad into some heat they couldn't handle.
Glad I'm not in there.
The seps must be wall-to-wall in there. This is bad, Sergeant.
Still no signal from Havoc Squad, sir. I think we may have lost them.
All right, people, listen up. This mission will not fail on my watch. We are not gonna let that bomb get away again!
Infiltrating that stronghold is a mission only Havoc Squad can pull off. Lucky for us, we have one Havoc trooper left! Sergeant--you're going in there!
The ZR-57 must not remain in separatist hands. Is that clear, Sergeant?
Affirmative.
Shouldn't I confirm Havoc's status, sir? They may need backup ASAP.
What about my squad?
The ZR-57 is your primary objective. Once it's dealt with, we'll see what we can do for Tavus and the others.
You're asking the impossible.
Maybe so, but you're the only trooper we've got with any chance of success.
We were hoping to get the bomb back intact, but we're way south of a best-case scenario here. So here's the new plan:
We have the deactivation code for the ZR-57. We disarm the bomb--leaving the seps with nothing but a big, radioactive paperweight.
You'll have to hijack the separatists' comm system to broadcast the code. This data spike should do the trick.
I never thought it'd come to this, Sergeant. I don't need to tell you what happens if you don't pull this off.
I've never failed a mission before, and I'm not gonna start today.
You can count on me, sir.
That's what I like to hear!
I enjoy a challenge.
Just play it safe out there. We have zero room for errors on this one.
You going soft on me or something, Lieutenant? Come on.
Stop it--I'm getting misty.
Sergeant, this is serious.
You have the coordinates for the separatists' stronghold. I'm sure you can guess how much security they're likely to have.
Breach the perimeter, use that data spike on the comm terminal and shut the ZR-57 down for good. Thousands of lives are on the line here, Sergeant. We're counting on you.
For freedom!
It's time to go to work.
I've got a job to do.
This op is going to make my career.
Time to rack up some glory.
Better be sure you survive it, then.
Good luck, Sergeant.
Ah, Sergeant, welcome back. Grab yourself a seat. You're gonna be observing the op here with me.
I take it the rest of my squad is already in the field?
Very well, sir.
Observing what op? Where are Commander Tavus and the others?
What are you talking about?
Havoc Squad is infiltrating the separatists' stronghold to retrieve the ZR-57 as we speak.
I'm supposed to just sit here while everyone else goes in?
This is insulting!
Afraid so. Commander Tavus took Havoc Squad into the separatists' stronghold to retrieve the ZR-57. They're breaching the perimeter as we speak.
Come on in, Sergeant. I copied everything--sounds like we're gonna be hitting the separatists where they live. Good work.
Thank you, sir.
I hope you're ready for this. The mountain stronghold is the separatists' most fortified position on the entire island--getting in there won't be easy.
I'm a charming person, what can I say?
I have a way with people.
Nothing like questioning worthless traitors to get the blood flowing.
I love a good interrogation.
Yeah, I guess you missed your calling. Just hang on before you file for that transfer--we still got work to do. Infiltrating that mountain stronghold isn't going to be easy.
I've put out the call. Havoc is assembling immediately, so get back here on the double.
Roger that, sir.
I can't wait to take these seps down once and for all.
Let's do it!
You and me both, Sergeant.
The seps are cornered--there's no need to rush.
We've got this in the bag.
Cornered enemies are the most dangerous of all, Sergeant.
Jorgan out.
Zak's house is in Oradam village. Get a move on, Sergeant!
Welcome back, Sergeant. Needles has your newest assignment.
Mannett Point is an island off the coast, Sergeant. Hope you're ready for a swim.
You would've let your fellow soldiers die. I can't believe you, Sergeant.
You stopped the ambush, Sergeant. Not too shabby.
All right, Sergeant. I copied what Mirru said, and this bomb situation sounds like the real thing.
How should I proceed?
Your point?
Your job, Sergeant. You're already close, so you have the best chance of anyone to stop this ambush.
I don't trust a word that bum says.
Mirru is just leading us on.
That's why it's my call, not yours.
I want you to head for the road Mirru described and locate the separatists' hidden bombs.
A troop convoy is scheduled to move through the area any minute now, so you need to get those bombs defused ASAP. Double-time it, soldier!
I'll move out right away!
Yes, sir!
I do my best work under pressure.
Nothing like a good challenge.
Jorgan out.
Not my mission, or my problem.
Those are Republic troopers, Sergeant! You will not ignore a threat to the lives of our comrades, regardless of your original mission!
Now stop arguing and get those bombs defused! Now!
You have your assignment, Sergeant. Stop wasting time.
Great. You're back. Fuse has your next mission, Sergeant.
Great, Bellis is KIA. That's some fine work, Sergeant! Do you think you could've taken a little longer to get to the RV point?
I got here as fast as I could.
I'm sorry, sir.
Not fast enough, rookie.
It isn't my fault Bellis went and got himself killed.
Don't blame me.
Yes, I'm sure the fact that he was standing around suspiciously waiting for you to arrive had nothing to do with him getting shot.
Sir, please come and assist me if you feel it would be beneficial, sir!
You think you could do better?
This isn't a joke, Sergeant.
However, there is a chance you might be able to find out what Bellis learned.
If he followed procedure, Bellis should've left a coded recording of his discovery in his field box, hidden somewhere inside his home in Talloran.
I'll search Bellis's home immediately.
Copy that, sir.
Is there a standard location where Bellis would've hidden the box?
Where in the house, exactly?
Negative, it could be just about anywhere. Tear the place apart if you have to--just find that box.
I'm hearing a lot of "ifs" and "shoulds" here, sir.
You don't sound very sure.
Well, let's just hope that Bellis was a better spy than you are a soldier, or this mission is going to be a complete failure.
Remember: If the separatists know Bellis was a spy, they may already be searching his house or waiting to ambush Republic agents as they come. Stay alert.
You have to get that field box from Bellis's house before the separatists do. Double-time it.
Will do.
Permission to resume my mission, Lieutenant?
Just let me work.
Just get it done.
If this doesn't go the way you say it will, we're gonna have a problem, sir.
This better work out.
As long as you start doing your job, we'll be fine.
Jorgan out.
You have your orders, Sergeant. Quit wasting time and move out.
I'm sure you have something else you should be doing, Sergeant.
I'm busy. Go bother someone else.
